TextView.android:text: What is Prakriti? The whole of the universe and the human body is said to be composed of the same elements, according to Ayurveda. The essence of the world is what powers a human being as well and it is believed in Ayurveda that the world is made of 5 elements. The 5 elements are ether, air, fire, water, and earth. These five elements are present in the tridosha that are Vata, Pitta and Kapha, which have these 5 elements at different proportions. The five elements form the tridosha in this manner Ether + Air = Vata Earth + Water = Kapha Water + Fire = Pitta Prakriti is regarded as the bodily or physical constitution and the psychological constitution of a person which is either of these doshas. Every individual has a unique bodily composition and no two people share the same dosha. Why is Prakriti important in Avurveda? Understanding of Prakriti can form the learning for the founding blocks of Ayurveda. This is because Ayurveda believes that health refers to the balance of these doshas and not merely an absence of disease. Ayurveda as a system of medicine does not generalise medicine or treat a disease based on its individual distinction or symptoms. Ayurveda is more holistic in nature as it considers a person's habits, lifestyle, food, mental and emotional state. Ayurveda functions on absolute principles and Prakriti is one such. Prakriti is formed right at the time of conception and determines every aspect of one's life like appetite, skin, hair, ageing process, sleep patterns and much more than we usually realise. Hence, if someone is aiming to be at the pink of health, they need a thorough understanding of what works for them and what doesn't, according to their body type.
